meanings.definition: To boast or brag more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She kept outbragging her friends about her new bike.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outbrag his classmates about his grades.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was outbragging the other animals about finding the biggest acorn.
meanings.sent4: The sun outbragged the moon in brightness that night.
meanings.sent5: The wind outbragged the trees with its howling sound.

meanings.definition: The act of bragging more than others.
meanings.sent1: His outbragging annoyed everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: The outbragging in the room was getting out of hand.
meanings.sent3: The outbragging contest at the office was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: Her outbragging was like a loud trumpet in a quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The outbragging of the peacock caught everyone's attention.
